text:
So the @EnvAgency has published its annual report, 5 months late.

Apparently they "Have achieved a huge amount over the last year", obviously including, not a single river in England reaches 'Good' overall environmental health.

Spent ¬£1.431 billion and employed 10,229 staff. https://t.co/0aEhhtaw8p
RT @StevenD81467662: @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Keep highlighting poor performance by our regulators Feargal. We love our countryside and‚Ä¶

RT @Feargal_Sharkey: Meanwhile back in the real world the @EnvAgency have applied for an abstraction licence.

Why? To pump water from the‚Ä¶

text: @MerryAlbright @bettwsresident Unlikely to be an algal bloom - not at this time of year and these temps. Possibly suspended sediment but that also seems odd given that it hasn't rained for a while now. Leaking silage effluent? DaveThroupEA @EnvAgencyMids @HelenStace_HWT River Arrow is a trib of #RiverLugg
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Keep highlighting poor performance by our regulators Feargal. We love our countryside and our rivers and we appreciate everything you do.... there is an army behind you!

@IvelRev @EnvAgencyAnglia @AffinityWater @AquiferChalk @OliverHealdUK @EnvAgency I can't help thinking the barbel population would be a lot healthier with a proper baseline flow right from the top end. Maybe the restocking would not be so necessary.

@Parrog3 @EnvAgencyAnglia @AffinityWater @AquiferChalk @OliverHealdUK Nothing lives when there‚Äôs no water. The upper reaches of the Ivel are biologically dead. It needs water all year round every year. The EA have a significant part to play in mandating this. @AquiferChalk @AffinityWater @EnvAgency @OliverHealdUK

@DefraGovUK @TonyJuniper @NaturalEngland @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @williamrworsley @ForestryEngland Fipronil is yet another chemical destroying our wildlife. It has been banned for use in agriculture because it is highly toxic and yet is a common ingredient in pet flea & tick spot ons. Please join out new campaign to ban this unnecessary chemical.

text: @DefraGovUK @TonyJuniper @NaturalEngland @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @williamrworsley @ForestryEngland But your main focus is #GeneEditing and #Neonicotinoids. Are these supported by the abovementioned? Next you'll be telling us that battery hens are the most sustainable source of income, and organic eggs are banned.
